children.text: Wellyboots recognises the importance of having robust systems in place to ensure the safe arrival and departure of the children in our care.

The manager will ensure that an accurate record is kept of all children in attendance and that any arrivals or departures are recorded in the register. The register is kept in an accessible location on the premises at all times. In addition, we conduct regular headcounts.
Arrivals
Our staff will greet each child warmly on their arrival and will record the child’s attendance in the daily register straight away, including the time of arrival.
The parent will need to ring on outside doorbell and wait for either kelly or Greg to greet them.
Hand sanitiser will be applied to the children’s hands upon greeting.
The staff member will talk briefly to the parent, checking all ok with the children but all communication will need to be done through the Class dojo App, email or telephone call.
When children go inside they will be asked to remove outside shoes and leave them in a box outside (weather permitting).
Hands to be washed on entry.
Departures

Normally staff will ensure that parents or carers sign children out before they leave, including the time of collection, however this would breech all of the above restrictions. Therefore we will note the time and just confirm that that’s the time you collected.
Children are collected by an adult who has been authorised to do so on their registration form.
Ideally, we would prefer that it is the same person doing the collection each day.
The children will be outside at time of collection (weather permitting) and would ask you to ring the door bell if we are inside and wait. We will collect your child’s things and bring them to you.
Again we will not engage in long conversations and will once again refer to telephone call, email or Class dojo app.
The parent or carer must notify us if they will be late collecting their child. If we are not informed, the
Uncollected Children
policy will be followed.
Absences
If a child is going to be absent from a session, parents must notify us in advance.
If a child is absent without explanation, staff will contact the parents or carers to check where the child should be.
